org.jcatapult.jpa
Class DefaultJPAService

java.lang.Object
  org.jcatapult.jpa.DefaultJPAService
All Implemented Interfaces:
JPAService
public class DefaultJPAService
extends Object
implements JPAService

This class implements the JPA service. It is a singleton and in the constructor it sets up the EntityManagerFactory.

This class is a singleton since it constructs the EntityManagerFactory in the constrcutor and holds a reference to it.

Constructor Summary
DefaultJPAService(boolean jpaEnabled, String persistentUnit)
           
 
Method Summary
 void closeFactory()
          Closes the factory.
 EntityManagerFactory getFactory()
          
 void setupEntityManager()
          This method creates a new EntityManager and sets it into the ThreadLocal storage so that it can be accessed elsewhere in the application.
 void tearDownEntityManager()
          This method removes the EntityManager from the ThreadLocal storage and cleans things up.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

DefaultJPAService

public DefaultJPAService(boolean jpaEnabled,
                         String persistentUnit)
Parameters:
jpaEnabled - If true, JPA will be setup, false it will not. A boolean flag controlled by the jcatapult configuration property named jcatapult.jpa.enabled that controls whether or not JPA will be initialized and then setup during each request.
persistentUnit - The name of the JPA persistent unit to use if JPA is being setup. This is controlled by the jcatapult configuration property named jcatapult.jpa.unit.
Method Detail

getFactory

public EntityManagerFactory getFactory()

Specified by:
getFactory in interface JPAService
Returns:
The EntityManagerFactory if JPA is enabled and correctly configured. This will return null if JPA is disabled.

setupEntityManager

public void setupEntityManager()
This method creates a new EntityManager and sets it into the ThreadLocal storage so that it can be accessed elsewhere in the application.

Specified by:
setupEntityManager in interface JPAService

tearDownEntityManager

public void tearDownEntityManager()
This method removes the EntityManager from the ThreadLocal storage and cleans things up.

Specified by:
tearDownEntityManager in interface JPAService

closeFactory

public void closeFactory()
Closes the factory.

Specified by:
closeFactory in interface JPAService
